fields_of_interest: Consumers, Education and training, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, Public Health, Food Safety
eu_initiatives: All European initiatives, policies and legislation related to sustainability (e.g. eco-design, LCA and post-consumer waste management and recycling), the European Circular Economy and plastics strategy, and all other other related environmental, health and consumer safety matters.
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
Petcore Europe organises one annual major public event in Brussels: the Petcore Europe conference - where all PET above related topics are openly discussed across the entire value chain and other stakeholders from the European institutions, NGOs and other related businesses.  
 
Petcore Europe also organises specific public workshops where key activities are presented (by means of Working Groups open to non-members who can actively contribute), such as a Thermoforms one in 2015, a Markers for post-consumer plastics waste identification one in 2016, one on the completion of a EU-funded Polymark project, one on ODR (Opaque and Difficult to Recycle) and a new one on Thermoforms 2017.  
  
Petcore Europe has a public website - www.petcore-europe.org - where press releases, report and other information are regularly updated.
goals__remit:
Petcore Europe is the European association and the voice of the entire PET value chain in Brussels. PET is an outstanding packaging material, and it is the largest plastic material recycled in Europe. 
 
Petcore Europe represents all other associations and a significant number of companies involved in PET manufacture, PET packaging design and conversion, PET post-consumer recycling and other related activities. Detailed information is available on www.petcore-europe.org
